page.title: 17AYMESTREY AREA- HOUSING
page.content: Apart from one or two modern houses and 6 council houses (2 at Yatton,4 at Lucton) most people live in converted farm cottages or farm houses, making comfortable modernised interiors but still retaining old features (beamed ceilings,huge open fireplaces etc). All houses have mains electricity but no mains gas or mains sewage (use septic tanks) and nearly all are on the phone.{The Welsh Water Authority provides mains water to Aymestrey and Lucton villages and to Yatton but all other dwellings pump their own from bore holes or springs. Large gardens are a feature of most houses and often an adjoining small orchard growing cider apples. Wood is used often as a fuel,in open fires ,wood burning stoves for cooking and central heating, and many have electric oil or propane gas heating.
